result.execSummary:
The defendant Arturo J Juarez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud (Valium), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
In the Wisconsin State Prison System
Consecutive

superMiscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
Take prescribed medications as prescribed and keep agent informed.
AODA, treatment or programs as recommended. 
Do not use or possess illegally controlled substances; random screening.
Mental health treatment or counseling as recommended.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Concurrent. Court recommends supervision with the Mental Health Unit.

miscConds.notes: No violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause. Do not use or possess any illegally controlled substances.
Comply with the six month program at The Bridge.
Pay a fine of $100 plus costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant. Provide a specimen for DNA testing and pay the surcharges if not already done.
Court advises defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Arturo J Juarez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) take prescribed medications as prescribed and keep agent informed; 3) AODA, treatment or programs as recommended; 4) do not use or possess illegally controlled substances; 5) random screening;
 6) mental health treatment or counseling as recommended.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance abuse Program.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a specimen for DNA testing and pay the surcharge - if not already done.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant.  COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, must provide a DNA specimen for testing and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 2 years - consecutive; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 1 year; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 1 year.  COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 3  years - concurrent.  Court recommends supervision with the mental health unit. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  1) no violations of the criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) do not use or possess any illegally controlled substances; 3) comply with the six month program at The Bridge; 4) pay a fine of $100 plus costs, assessments and surcharges or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant.

Defendant Arturo J Juarez in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Arturo J Juarez not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Court stays a bench warrant to the next date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Arturo J Juarez not in court, in custody.  Kevin R. Shomin for Patricia Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Court stays a bench warrant to the next date.  
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Arturo J Juarez in court with attorney Vincent Guimont.  Defendant Arturo J Juarez in custody.  William Levins for Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Arturo J Juarez in court with attorney Vincent Guimont.  Defendant Arturo J Juarez in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
